data.title: V3 winrt js keyboard support
data.body: This pull requests enables keyboard support for WinRT platforms in cocos2d-js. We need to enable keyboard so the app can receive back button events on Windows Phones.

data.title: V3: WinRT unsupported cocos2d-x image formats removed or updated
data.body: This pull request removes unsupported cocos2d-x image formats from the WinRT WIC converter (we use this native code to decode png files).

data.title: win8.1 crash when loading specific png file
data.body:
Using this png file: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B1_hJ_Q8mPOBWWtzV3ZKUFhBNHc&authuser=0

and replacing the "HelloWorld.png" by "flare.png" in the template project
v3.5 and before: OK
v3.6 and 3.7 : crash

Only crashing on Win8.1-universal build.
Win32/ios/android/mac are all OK

Crash is in CCTexture2D.cpp, inside bool Texture2D::initWithImage(Image *image, PixelFormat format):
Line PixelFormat      renderFormat = image->getRenderFormat();
returns PixelFormat::NONE on win8.1, PixelFormat::RGB888 on other platforms.

This time it's sure, I won't make it for the contest :(

data.title: self:getApp():enterScene("MyScene", "MOVEINB") got exception
data.body:
I use cocos2dx 3.5.

When I call self:getApp():enterScene("MyScene", "MOVEINB"), there is an exception.

```
function display.wrapScene(scene, transition, time, more)
    local key = string.upper(tostring(transition))

    if key == "RANDOM" then
        local keys = table.keys(display.SCENE_TRANSITIONS)
        key = keys[math.random(1, #keys)]
    end

    if display.SCENE_TRANSITIONS[key] then
        local t = display.SCENE_TRANSITIONS[key]
        time = time or 0.2
        more = more or t[2]
        if type(t) == "table" then
            scene = t[1]:create(time, scene, more)
        else
            scene = t:create(time, scene)
        end
    else
        error(string.format("display.wrapScene() - invalid transition %s", tostring(transition)))
    end
    return scene
end

```

if type(t) == "table" then, this line will always be "table" and never go to else.

Because

```

display.SCENE_TRANSITIONS = {
    CROSSFADE       = cc.TransitionCrossFade,
    FADE            = {cc.TransitionFade, cc.c3b(0, 0, 0)},
    FADEBL          = cc.TransitionFadeBL,
    FADEDOWN        = cc.TransitionFadeDown,

```

all the display.SCENE_TRANSITIONS elements are tables.

So if I use FADE, ok, it works. others FADEEBL, FADEDOWN ... these elements which looks like not table values would go wrong.

data.title: SpriteFrameCache support async load
data.body:
Async based on Sprite3D and TextureCache.
Load texture and plist file in AsyncTaskPool TASK_IO thread.
Add TextureCache image and generate Sprite Frames in main thread.

update it: #12367

data.title: Renderer draw batched load data use glBufferSubData
data.body:
glBufferData deallocate old data, and allocate new data if data size
difference.
Renderer in mapBuffers allocate memory for VBO.
In Draw need update allocated data, not new allocated data!

My video driver per 1-5 sec, lags 300-1500 ms in this code.

data.title: v3.7-beta createWithTTF label size bug
data.body:
Hi,

it looks like v3.7 introduced a bug in the label size for TTF **Label**, compared to all previous cocos versions, as seen on this screenshot showing side-by-side an empty project (tested on win32 and win8.1 desktop), left is cocos3.6, right is cocos3.7 beta up-to-date at commitID 9f32db91549e25581f8c14f5dd95e84216106ca7 )
![labelbug-3 7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4882169/8392043/227167f2-1cdc-11e5-8e9d-7cd81d000cf1.PNG)

As you can see, the size is not correct, breaking all current games using TTF fonts.

cc.pIsSegmentIntersect

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
```
function cc.pIsSegmentIntersect(pt1,pt2,pt3,pt4)
    local s,t,ret = 0,0,false
    ret,s,t =cc.pIsLineIntersect(pt1, pt2, pt3, pt4,s,t)

    if ret and  s >= 0.0 and s <= 1.0 and t >= 0.0 and t <= 0.0 then
        return true
    end

    return false
end
```

> t010
> --from zhihu:http://www.zhihu.com/question/31163146/answer/52652050

@samuele3hu

data.body: Keypad support for onKeyPressed and onKeyReleased events when using lua bindings.

data.title: Physics-enabled nodes are teleported during a scene transition.
data.body:
When a scene transition is used to replace a scene, any physics-enabled nodes in the new scene are sometimes teleported to offscreen positions.  This is caused by `Node::updateTransformFromPhysics()`.

I worked around the issue by not loading sprites in `init` or `onEnter`, but did it in `onEnterTransitionDidFinish()` instead.

This is using v3.7 beta 0 (v3 branch).

See this article of the forum for more details: http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/probable-teleport-physics-bug-related-to-scene-transitions/22333
